Add task delay due to requiring consent from remote params

   * Move task management to TaskController
   * Delay task until remote params and init is done
   * After task delayed, check again for user consent
   * Fix test, add tests
Remove extra check/schedule on pending tasks

timeline.bodyText: We can remove the entire UI for this location shared interface now, not just the public method. I can deal with that later though. Lets add a TODO for now and explain that this public method was replaced with a remote param
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: agree, I created a ticket for UI updating
replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.bodyText: Remove this privacy consent boolean as well now
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText: Remove this location shared boolean as well now
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText: Are we keeping this public method for a reason? Isnt this a remote param now or are we keeping both?
timeline.author: mikechoch
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,7 +30,6 @@ public void onCreate() {
         OneSignal.unsubscribeWhenNotificationsAreDisabled(true);

replies.bodyText: Is the public method removed as well?
replies.author: mikechoch

timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -569,10 +531,8 @@ public static void setAppContext(@NonNull Context context) {
             OneSignal.onesignalLog(LOG_LEVEL.VERBOSE, "appContext set and an old appId was found, attempting to call setAppId(oldAppId)");

timeline.bodyText: Should we use logger.verbose here?
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText: Should we use logger.verbose here?
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText:
Add a space after :? SO when we append it we can read a little easier
Example:
OneSignal is shareLocation enabled: true
instead
OneSignal is shareLocation enabled:true
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason we used Boolean class instead of primitive for locationShared and requiresUserPrivacyConsent?
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: good catch, this was because on the first iteration I was initializing as null
replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: Do we need the responseJson.has(LOCATION_SHARED) check? Doesnt optBoolean do that internally?
replies.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: yup, if the value doesn't exist it will end on the fallback
replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: Do we need the responseJson.has(REQUIRES_USER_PRIVACY_CONSENT) check? Doesnt optBoolean do that internally?
replies.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: yup, if the value doesn't exist it will end on the fallback
replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.bodyText: Why did we change this app_id? Just curious
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: Because we have a check for this id on the initializationChecker under the init method on OneSignal.java and we don't want to test under that condition
replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.bodyText: Should we construct a JSONObject and use toString method instead of hardcoding this?
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: Its a mocked hardcoded response for testing, from my point of view, is easier to read in this way since there is a lot of data. But if you prefer to have it as a JsonObject yeah that wouldn't harm, let me know
replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.bodyText: ApplicationProvider.getApplicationContext() is okay to set context with also and it will be more consistent with our other UnitTests. However, I think we should call this inside of the UnitTests individually so its easier to understand that this is an important part of the new OneSignal init
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we should still pass in a boolean param so it's easier it read? I saw this always sets it true
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.author: Jeasmine
mikechoch

timeline.bodyText: new line OneSignalInit(); this
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText: Removed redundant if outside of synchronized
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText:
Integer.MAX_VALUE seems a bit aggressive maybe we should just do -1?
I don't think we have any negative subscription statuses, but maybe im wrong...
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.author: Jeasmine

replies.bodyText: Okay Integer.MAX_VALUE is fine then haha
replies.author: mikechoch
